creator: kenstir@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 23752
JMX file

When I use a Prepared Select Statement in 2.3.2 against postgresql-8.3.7, it works (although it seems to me to be parsing too many times).  When I use the same JMX file with jmeter-2.3.3, it fails with "This statement has been closed".

Created attachment 23753
jmeter.log from 2.3.3 as requested on mailing list
creator: kenstir@gmail.com
kenstir@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 23756
log file output from 233 View Results in Table listener

The JMX file has "Max number of connections" = 2.

The JMeter 2.3.3 log shows problems creating the /tmp directory:

jmeter.reporters.ResultCollector: Error creating directories for /tmp

Please fix these errors and try the 2.3.3 test again.
creator: sebb@apache.org
kenstir@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 23758
new JMX with connection pool set to 0

I set max number of connections to 0 and it did not fix the problem.

Created attachment 23759
New jmeter.log after JMX changes

The only way to get rid of the message

WARN  - jmeter.reporters.ResultCollector: Error creating directories for /tmp

Is to specify a directory in the listener that does not exist.  Otherwise you get this warning.
creator: kenstir@gmail.com

text:
(In reply to comment #6)
> The only way to get rid of the message
> 
> WARN  - jmeter.reporters.ResultCollector: Error creating directories for /tmp
> 
> Is to specify a directory in the listener that does not exist.  Otherwise you
> get this warning.

OK, agreed. Bug has been fixed in SVN.
creator: sebb@apache.org
sebb@apache.org
text:
Fixed in SVN:

URL: http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?rev=783459&view=rev
Log:
JDBC Sampler should not close Prepared or Callable statements as these are cached
